channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: India is retrieving its stolen artefacts and relics. Here's how
In Graphics | Key facts and figures of India's Union Budget
Will Pakistan use IMF money to join Trump’s Board of Peace?
How a pregnant Delhi Police commando was murdered with a dumbbell by her husband
What are Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez doing at Paris Couture Week? Is it business or...
Did the IAF bomb Pakistan’s Kirana Hills during Op Sindoor? A video suggests…
For US, India is both an ally and adversary
item.description: Not only will India in the 2050s be the world’s largest democracy but also the world’s largest economy.

item.title: US Sutra | America is at war with itself: Minnesota is just the tip of the iceberg
item.description: The shooting of Alex Pretti on January 24 in the ongoing Minnesota siege has once again foregrounded the deep divisions in the American state and society.

item.title: Venezuela and India’s red line on Bangladesh: What Delhi should learn from Trump’s raid
item.description: India defined its red lines by pulverising terror bases in Pakistan during Operation Sindoor. Now it is time to set a red line on Bangladesh

item.title: Trump’s Board of Peace: A new world order without the United Nations?
item.description: The White House, bypassing the UN, has invited more than 60 countries to join the Donald Trump-headed Board of Peace in Davos

item.title: A strategic confluence: Why the India-EU trade deal matters
item.description: The India-EU trade deal is less about romance than realism. Like the sangam, it brings together two currents that need each other more than they admit

item.title: How Xi Jinping’s power grab spells global looming crisis
item.description: As Xi Jinping amasses unprecedented power through relentless purges, China risks internal chaos and global instability in an era of one-man rule.
